direction.description:
start: the image starts on the left side of the component 
end: The image starts on the right side of the component

content.description: Please use short, descriptive text that provide context to where you are redirecting the user to. Don't use phrases such as "this document", "this article", or "click here".

to.description: Please provide the telephone number. Only numbers allowed.

content.description:
Good practices to improve usability and accessibility:

H1 (Heading level 1)
The H1 is mandatory and should describe the page content. Each page must have only one H1.

H2-H6 (Headings level 2 to 6)
The remaining headings should describe the text that follows it and be used in hierarchical order. Never use headings for stylistic purposes. Instead, use them to structure your content and help readers navigate through the content easily.
More info: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/Heading_Elements

Links
Use descriptive text that accurately reflects the destination of the link. Avoid generic phrases like "click here" or "read more."

Italic
Use italics sparingly and purposefully. They are best suited for emphasising specific words or phrases.

Bold
Use bold to highlight essential points, keywords, or key phrases. This helps readers quickly identify the most critical information in your blog post.
